name: stuffed batbout
ingredients: For the dough: 210 g of wheat flour, 200 g of fine durum wheat semolina, 120 g of water, 100 g of milk, 1 packet of dry baker's yeast, 1 tbsp of honey, 40 g of olive oil, 6 pinches of salt

For the filling (ground meat and tomato): 100 g of onion, 1 clove of garlic, ¼ tsp of ground cumin, ¼ tsp of smoked paprika, 125 g of red bell peppers cut into pieces, 200 g of ground meat, 200 g of tomatoes cut into pieces, 4 tsp of curry powder, salt, pepper
steps: Prepare the batbout dough (similar to the basic recipe: mix the ingredients, knead, let rise, shape into discs). Let the discs rest for 1 hour.
Prepare the filling: Chop the onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, and bell peppers. Sauté them. Add the ground meat, tomatoes, curry, salt, and pepper. Let simmer until the filling is cooked and dry.
Cook the batbouts in a very hot dry pan (without filling) until they puff up and are golden. Let them cool slightly on a rack.
Make a slit on the side of each batbout. Fill with the stuffing. Add fresh coriander and a sprinkle of fleur de sel.
